answerText: Hubble constant [10] The rate of the expansion of the universe is increasing, which most scientists agree is due to this gravitationally repulsive hypothetical energy.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | University of Pittsburgh A and Walter Johnson High School | 8 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The universe is expanding. True. Further explore that statement,  [10] This is the constant, estimated to be around 73 km/s/mpc, ("kilometers per second per megaparsec") which represents the rate at which the universe is expanding.
